title: Demo Complete
content:
# English Grammar Exercise: Mixed Tenses and Conditionals

## Instructions
Complete the following exercises by filling in the blanks with the correct verb forms and conditional structures.

---

## Part I: Present Perfect vs Past Simple (20 points)

### Exercise 1: Choose the correct tense

1. I { } (study) English for five years, but I { } (start) learning when I was 10.

2. She { } (never visit) London, but she { } (go) to Paris last year.

3. How long { } (you work) at this company? I { } (join) in 2020.

4. We { } (not see) that movie yet, but we { } (watch) it last week.

5. { } (you ever be) to Japan? Yes, I { } (go) there three times.

### Exercise 2: Complete with the correct form

6. By this time next year, I { } (graduate) from university.

7. Look at those clouds! It { } (rain) soon.

8. I { } (finish) my homework by 8 PM tonight.

9. They { } (not arrive) yet, but they { } (call) an hour ago.

10. { } (you ever try) sushi? No, I { } (never eat) Japanese food.

---

## Part II: Conditionals (25 points)

### Exercise 3: First Conditional

11. If it { } (rain) tomorrow, we { } (stay) at home.

12. Unless you { } (study) hard, you { } (not pass) the exam.

13. If she { } (call) me, I { } (tell) her the news.

14. We { } (go) to the beach if the weather { } (be) nice.

15. If you { } (not hurry), you { } (miss) the train.

### Exercise 4: Second Conditional

16. If I { } (be) rich, I { } (travel) around the world.

17. She { } (buy) a new car if she { } (have) enough money.

18. If we { } (live) in Paris, we { } (learn) French.

19. I { } (help) you if I { } (know) how to do it.

20. If it { } (not rain) so much, the garden { } (look) better.

### Exercise 5: Third Conditional

21. If I { } (wake up) early, I { } (not miss) the train.

22. She { } (save) money if she { } (not buy) so many clothes.

23. If we { } (leave) earlier, we { } (arrive) on time.

24. I { } (pass) the exam if I { } (study) harder.

25. If it { } (not rain) yesterday, we { } (go) to the park.

---

## Part III: Mixed Conditionals (15 points)

### Exercise 6: Complete the sentences

26. If I { } (study) harder, I { } (pass) the exam.

27. If she { } (be) here now, she { } (help) us with this project.

28. If I { } (know) about the traffic, I { } (leave) earlier.

29. If you { } (not smoke), you { } (feel) better.

30. If we { } (have) more time, we { } (visit) the museum.

---

## Part IV: Writing Section (20 points)

### Essay Question
Write a 150-word essay on: "The importance of learning English in today's world"

**Your essay:**
{Write your essay here about the importance of learning English in today's world. Include examples of how English is used in business, technology, education, and international communication. Explain why it's beneficial to learn English and how it can open doors to new opportunities.}

---

## Part V: Vocabulary (10 points)

### Exercise 7: Match the words with their definitions

31. { } (abundant) - existing in large quantities
32. { } (diligent) - showing care and effort in work
33. { } (elaborate) - involving many carefully arranged parts
34. { } (fascinating) - extremely interesting
35. { } (genuine) - truly what something is said to be

---

## Part VI: Reading Comprehension (10 points)

### Exercise 8: Read the text and answer the questions

**Text:**
"The rapid advancement of technology has transformed the way we communicate, work, and learn. English has become the lingua franca of the digital age, connecting people from different cultures and backgrounds. From social media platforms to professional networks, English serves as the common language that bridges gaps and facilitates global understanding."

**Questions:**

36. According to the text, what has technology transformed? { } (Answer here)

37. What is English considered in the digital age? { } (Answer here)

38. How does English help people from different cultures? { } (Answer here)

39. What platforms are mentioned in the text? { } (Answer here)

40. What does English facilitate? { } (Answer here)

---

$$
$$
$$

**Total Points: 100**

Student Name: { } 

Date: { }
